CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length);Partly inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was dismissed from her position at the Osijek Faculty of Agriculture ( “ the Faculty ” ) . The decision had retroactive effect as of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings challenging the lawfulness of the ORG 's decision . She claimed to have never been reinstated , as was required by a final court decision from proceedings she had previously instituted against ORG , and that she could therefore not have been dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) ruled in the applicant 's favour , ordering the Faculty to reinstate her .
CARDINAL . Following an appeal by the Faculty , on DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) upheld the first instance judgment .

CARDINAL . The Faculty subsequently filed a request for revision on points of law ( revizija ) . On DATE , ORG ( PERSON ) reversed the first and second instance judgments and dismissed the applicant 's claim . ORG found that the Faculty was under no obligation to reinstate the applicant and that therefore its decision was in line with the applicable law .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) . She claimed that ORG judgment was in breach of her constitutional right to work , of the rule of law and of the requirement that the courts adjudicate on the basis of laws and LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed her complaint finding no violation of the alleged constitutional rights .
